info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 8:06PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cabarrus, southeastern Lincoln, south central Iredell, northern Mecklenburg and northeastern Gaston Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 806 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Huntersville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Huntersville, Northeast Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, Cornelius, Davidson, Harrisburg, University City, Reedy Creek Park, Lake Norman and Charlotte Motor Speedway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
